summary: Email chain between attorney Gloria Allred and federal officials regarding a new alleged victim of Jeffrey Epstein who is willing to attend a victim meeting in New York on October 23, 2019. The correspondence involves coordination for the victim's travel and attendance.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: Attorney representing a new alleged victim of Jeffrey Epstein, communicating with FBI and AUSA to arrange the victim's attendance at a meeting.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the perpetrator against whom the new client is an alleged victim.

connections.description: Allred is representing a client who is an alleged victim of Epstein, establishing a legal connection through victim representation.

events.title: Victim Meeting in New York
events.description: A meeting for victims of Jeffrey Epstein, organized by the FBI, which a new alleged victim represented by Gloria Allred is willing to attend.

locations: 6300 Wilshire Blvd., Suite 1500, Los Angeles, CA
St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Attorney Gloria Allred informed federal officials on October 21, 2019, that she has a new client who is an alleged victim of Jeffrey Epstein.
The new alleged victim was willing to fly to New York to attend a victim meeting scheduled for October 23, 2019, which was being run by the FBI.

An Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York confirmed availability to meet with the new client on October 23 and requested identifying information to coordinate travel logistics.
The email chain indicates ongoing coordination between victim attorneys and law enforcement following Epstein's arrest and death to connect with additional victims.
